resource.chars:
Mike Stevens should make a fine
captain for the foot ball team next
Fall. Although a real sportsman,
quiet and unassuming, Mike posses-
ses plenty of fight and determina-
tion and is sure to set a fast pace
for his teammates. In fact, if all
the gridmen tried to follow Mike’s
lead, Coach Curley Byrd doubtless
would have to call a halt or his
players soon would be ragged.
Mike bespoke the stuff of which
he is made when he said at the ban-
quet: “With all the backfield ma-
terial that will be left from this
season’s team and that coming up
from the Freshmen eleven it ap-
pears to me as if the captain would
be warming the bench most of the
time.”
However, if Curly can develop
enough backs to keep Mike on the
bench, he will have a mighty sweet
array of ball carriers. But at any
rate. Mike showed that he is the
kind of a fellow who would willing-
ly sit on the side lines if there is a
better man to fill his shoes. That’s
the real spirit.
U. of M.
